ai_images.text: AI-generated images generally not permitted for publication (exceptions only if the tool itself is the object of study and transparently described).

peer_review_ai.text: Restricted/typically prohibited due to confidentiality expectations.

notes: Emphasis on transparency, accountability, and risks of fabricated content/citations.

ai_writing_assist.text: Allowed (subject to policy; disclose where requested).

ai_images.text: AI-generated images/multimedia not permitted without explicit editor permission (exceptions possible).

disclosure_where: As required by journal policy (often Acknowledgements/Methods)
notes: Strong focus on integrity and author responsibility.

ai_writing_assist.text: Allowed with disclosure; authors must fact-check outputs.

ai_content_generation.text: Conditional with disclosure; authors responsible for accuracy.

ai_images.text: AI tools for images/graphics not permitted unless the software is the subject of the work.

disclosure_where: In manuscript per PNAS policy (commonly Acknowledgements/Methods)
notes: Explicit AI guidance; strong stance on AI-generated images.

journal: Elsevier journals (e.g., Cell Press / Social Science & Medicine)

ai_writing_assist.text: Allowed for writing assistance with disclosure (excluding basic grammar/spell check).

ai_content_generation.text: Conditional; must disclose use of generative AI/AI-assisted technologies in writing.

ai_images.text: Restricted; follow journal/policy rules and ensure rights; disclose when relevant.

peer_review_ai.text: Restricted; confidentiality concerns in review process.

disclosure_where: A specific declaration/statement in the manuscript (often before References) per Elsevier guidance
notes: Elsevier policy focuses on transparency in writing; research-method use is not the target of the writing policy.

journal: SAGE journals (e.g., New Media & Society, Communication Research)

ai_writing_assist.text: Assistive use allowed (SAGE notes assistive use no longer requires disclosure).

ai_content_generation.text: Generative use requires disclosure; prohibitive uses not allowed.

ai_code_generation.text: Allowed (verify; disclose if material / if generative).

ai_literature_search.text: Allowed (verify sources; disclosure if generative output used materially).

ai_images.text: Restricted; follow journal guidance; disclose where relevant.

peer_review_ai.text: Restricted/prohibited to protect confidentiality and integrity.

disclosure_where: Per SAGE policy; journal may specify exact placement
notes: SAGE explicitly distinguishes assistive vs generative vs prohibitive uses.

journal: Taylor & Francis journals (e.g., Information, Communication & Society)

ai_writing_assist.text: Allowed (disclose when beyond basic editing, per policy expectations).

ai_content_generation.text: Conditional; disclose and ensure responsible use.

ai_images.text: Restricted; disclose/ensure rights; journal-specific rules may apply.

disclosure_where: Per T&F AI policy; journal may specify placement
notes: Disclosure-centric; details can differ for books vs journals.

journal: Oxford University Press (example journal AI policy page)

ai_writing_assist.text: Allowed but must be disclosed in cover letter and Methods/Acknowledgements (per OUP policy page).

ai_images.text: AI-generated images/graphics not permitted unless the software is the subject of the work.

peer_review_ai.text: OUP example policy does not support AI as substitute for human expertise in review.

disclosure_where: Cover letter + Methods or Acknowledgements (per the OUP journal AI policy page)
notes: OUP also has broader author AI guidance; journal pages may be more explicit for articles.

ai_writing_assist.text: Allowed with disclosure/attribution expectations depending on use.

ai_content_generation.text: Conditional; authors must provide attribution to the generative AI tool where it generated ideas/content/analysis/code/research elements.

ai_images.text: Restricted; follow journal guidance and rights/ethics considerations.

disclosure_where: Per APA guidance (disclosure/attribution and appropriate documentation in manuscript)
notes: Explicitly mentions attribution when AI generates ideas/content/analysis/code/research elements.

ai_writing_assist.text: Allowed if transparent; authors remain responsible.

ai_content_generation.text: Conditional; must not obscure responsibility; transparency expected.

ai_literature_search.text: Allowed; verify sources; avoid fabricated citations.

ai_images.text: Depends on journal/publisher; COPE focuses on integrity and transparency.

peer_review_ai.text: Many journals disallow due to confidentiality; COPE emphasizes protecting review integrity.

notes: Useful as a portable minimum standard across venues.
